WhatIsSBPage.title: Understanding Spina Bifida: Causes, Types, and Care
WhatIsSBPage.intro: Spina Bifida is a neural tube defect that occurs during the first month of pregnancy. Learn about spina bifida treatment, symptoms, and lived experiences.

prevention.title: Prevention & Folic Acid
prevention.text: Scientific research shows that up to 70% of Spina Bifida cases can be prevented if women take 400mcg of Folic Acid daily. Folic acid and spina bifida prevention are strongly linked, and supplementation should start at least one month before conception.

occulta.desc: The 'hidden' form. There is typically a small gap in the spine but no opening or sac on the back. Most people live healthy lives without ever knowing.

meningocele.desc: A sac of fluid comes through an opening in the babyâ€™s back, but the spinal cord is not in this sac. Damage is usually minimal.

myelomeningocele.desc: The most complex form. A sac containing parts of the spinal cord and nerves comes through an opening. This causes moderate to severe disabilities often requiring spina bifida rehabilitation.

lipomyelomeningocele.desc: A form of Spina Bifida where a fatty mass is attached to the spinal cord. It can cause progressive nerve damage if not managed.

myths.title: Common Myths
myths.item: Myth: It is hereditary or a curse. Fact: It is a combination of genetic and environmental factors. It is not anyone's 'fault'. Is spina bifida genetic? While genetics play a role, it is not purely hereditary.

diagnosis.title: Spina Bifida Diagnosis
diagnosis.prenatal: Most cases are detected during pregnancy through blood tests (AFP) and detailed ultrasounds. How early can spina bifida be detected? Often as early as the second trimester.
diagnosis.postnatal: After birth, MRI or CT scans are used to get a clear picture of the spine and brain structure for spina bifida in babies.

treatment.title: Spina Bifida Treatment & Care
treatment.surgery: Surgery to close the spine is usually performed within 48 hours of birth. Some babies may also require a 'shunt' to manage fluid on the brain (hydrocephalus).
treatment.multidisciplinary: Spina bifida care services involve a team: neurosurgeons, urologists, orthopedic surgeons, and spina bifida specialists providing consultation.

management.title: Critical Care & Management
management.intro: Living with Spina Bifida requires lifelong vigilance to ensure the best quality of life. Accessing a spina bifida clinic for regular check-ups is crucial.

kidneyInfection.title: Protecting Kidneys
kidneyInfection.text: Preserving kidney function and staying vigilant against infections, especially UTIs, is a top priority.

orthopedic.title: Orthopedic Check-ups
orthopedic.text: Regular orthopedic monitoring by a spina bifida doctor is essential for maintaining mobility.

rehab.title: Spina Bifida Rehabilitation
rehab.text: Physical therapy and spina bifida therapy must be a consistent, lifelong part of the care routine.

psychology.title: Psychological Support
psychology.text: Mental health support allows for spina bifida support services that help with emotional well-being.

localCare.title: Spina Bifida Care in Azerbaijan
localCare.text: Finding a spina bifida specialist in Baku or spina bifida treatment in Azerbaijan can be challenging. We help connect families with pediatric neurology in Azerbaijan and rehabilitation for children in Baku regarding neural tube defect treatment in Azerbaijan.

faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.q1: What causes spina bifida in babies?
faq.a1: The exact cause is unknown, but it involves a mix of genetic and environmental factors, such as low folic acid intake.
faq.a2: Taking folic acid before and during early pregnancy significantly reduces the risk.
faq.a3: Treatment ranges from surgery after birth to ongoing physiotherapy and medical management.
faq.q4: Can people with spina bifida walk?
faq.a4: It depends on the severity. Many walk with assistance, while others use wheelchairs. Early spina bifida rehabilitation helps maximize mobility.
faq.q5: How to care for a child with spina bifida?
faq.a5: Regular check-ups with a spina bifida specialist, managing bathroom routines, and skin care are vital.
faq.a6: There is a genetic component, but 95% of babies with spina bifida are born to parents with no family history.

LivingWithPage.title: Life with Spina Bifida
LivingWithPage.intro: Every stage of life has its unique challenges and beautiful victories. We are with you on every step.

child.title: Childhood
child.desc: Early intervention is key. We support families with kindergarten integration, finding the right wheelchair, and establishing early physio routines.

teen.title: Adolescence
teen.desc: Navigating social life and body image during teenage years. We run confidence-building workshops and peer support groups.

adult.title: Adulthood
adult.desc: Advocating for independent living, university accessibility, and employment rights for adults with Spina Bifida.

philosophy.title: A Life Full of Possibilities
philosophy.text: "Spina Bifida is part of who you are, but it doesn't define who you will become. From para-athletics to academic excellence, our community members are proving every day that there are no limits to what can be achieved."
